note.p: Career: Rouge Croix Pursuivant (1690); Deputy Chamberlain of the Exchequer; Richmond Herald (1704); Norroy King of Arms (1704); worked on the history and antiquities of Norfolk, but published nothing himself; his library and some of his manuscripts were sold after his death at the Bedford Coffee-House, Covent Garden 1731
Memberships: First President of the Society of Antiquaries on its revival (1687-1724)
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Thomas; AB
References: Obituary in 'Historical Register Chronological Diary' 1729, p54
